bibl.title: Demarco v. McKay. Memo from Judge Continued
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: aforsaid with the said club did feloniously and of his malice aforthought hear and cruise with intern then and there felonously and of his malice aforthought to kill and murder the said John Doe whose true name is unknown as aforsaid against the peace and dignity of the said state of Texas.

That the said Frank Demarco is charged by the grand Jury of the said County of Collin in the said state of Texas with the comminsious of said evince. That the said Frank Demarco has fled from said state of Texas to avoid prosecution for the communion of said arrival and in new in Pierce County Washington Territory and is a fugitier from justice. Therefore in the name of the . United States you are commanded forthwich to apprehend the said Frank Demarco and bring him before me to be dealt with according to Law. Given under my hand this 7th day of March 1887
